page.title: 01The Geography of the Area
page.content: General Review. This area,on the northern side of the Market Weighton glacial morainic ridge,includes,in the south,the northern suburbs of York.Low-lying,the land is clay with sandy patches and conglomerate.The River Foss drains the land from N.to S.then enters the Ouse at York.Old nuclear villages,nestling by the meanders of the Foss,have expanded in the last 50 years into York's dormitory housing estates.The NE and E section of the area is mainly mixed lowland farming which,to a small extent,is beginning to see the early intrusion of light industries.Main established industries are:chocolate, optical instruments,buttons,farming. Many people travel S.on busy roads to the commerce,tourism,marketing and railway carriage works in York. Population is increasing outside York.
